title: Soros Fund ups stake in Microsoft, NVIDIA, Apple as part of Q4 moves
summary: Soros Fund Management significantly increased its holdings in major tech companies Microsoft, NVIDIA, and Apple during the fourth quarter. The fund added approximately 161,000 shares of Microsoft and about 118,000 shares of NVIDIA as part of its portfolio adjustments. This move highlights George Soros's fund's continued investment in the technology sector.

title: Prediction: Comfort Systems USA Will Soar in 2026
summary: Motley Fool contributors Jason Hall and Tyler Crowe predict that Comfort Systems USA (NYSE: FIX) is poised for significant growth in 2026. This projection is attributed to the company's strong position to benefit from the increasing demand for infrastructure related to artificial intelligence. The article encourages investors to consider this opportunity, highlighting past successful stock recommendations by Stock Advisor.
authors: Motley Fool, Jason Hall, Tyler Crowe

title: Is the YieldMax AAPL Option Income Strategy ETF’s (APLY) 70% Yield Real or Misleading?
summary: The article examines the YieldMax AAPL Option Income Strategy ETF (APLY), which boasts a 70.75% yield but relies on option strategies like covered calls. While the high yield is attractive, the ETF comes with 1.06% in annual operating expenses and its share price is prone to decline as distributions are paid out. The author concludes that while the yield isn't misleading, it is risk-prone due to share price weakness, suggesting that direct ownership of Apple stock might be a more prudent investment for many.

title: Mirova US LLC Boosts Apple Inc Stake by 15,420 Shares
summary: Mirova US LLC, managed by Philippe Zaouati, recently increased its stake in Apple Inc (AAPL) by 15,420 shares. Apple's stock has shown positive trading, with analysts maintaining a "Moderate Buy" view and projecting significant upside due to strong demand and growth in Services and AI. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates AAPL as "Outperform" based on strong financial performance and a constructive earnings outlook.

title: 1 Unpopular Stock That Deserves a Second Chance and 2 That Underwhelm
summary: This article analyzes three stocks, recommending Globalstar (GSAT) as a buying opportunity due to its impressive revenue growth, free cash flow profitability, and increasing returns on capital. Conversely, it advises investors to pass on Bally's (BALY) and Rocket Lab (RKLB) due to concerns like lackluster revenue growth, eroding returns, and negative free cash flow, respectively. The author suggests that Wall Street's pessimism towards GSAT creates an attractive entry point, while its skepticism about BALY and RKLB is well-founded.

title: Apple has worst day since April as company faces FTC scrutiny, Siri delay reports
summary: Apple experienced its worst stock market day since April 2025, with shares dropping 5%, due to two main factors. Reports emerged that the anticipated AI update for Siri within iOS is being delayed until at least May. Additionally, the company is facing scrutiny from FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson, who formally requested CEO Tim Cook review Apple News's content curation policies following allegations of bias against conservative news outlets.

title: LiveOne Inc (LVO) Q3 2026 Earnings Call Highlights: Strong Revenue Growth and Strategic Partnerships Amidst Competitive Challenges
summary: LiveOne Inc (LVO) reported robust Q3 2026 financial results with over $20 million in revenue and significant operating expense reductions. The company highlighted its strong B2B pipeline, including over 100 active enterprise opportunities and expanding partnerships with major tech companies. Despite a net loss of $4.1 million and market skepticism, LiveOne is confident in its customized white-label solutions and sustainable cost structure to drive future growth.

title: Eversource Energy earnings missed, revenue topped estimates
summary: Eversource Energy (NYSE: ES) reported its Q4 earnings, with an EPS of $1.12, missing analyst estimates of $1.13. However, the company's revenue for the quarter reached $3.37 billion, surpassing the consensus estimate of $2.94 billion. Despite the earnings miss, Eversource Energy provided a positive outlook, forecasting FY 2026 EPS to be between $4.80 and $4.95.

title: Form 424B2 BARCLAYS BANK PLC
summary: This SEC filing from Barclays Bank PLC outlines the terms for $1,501,000 Callable Contingent Coupon Notes due August 13, 2027, linked to the performance of Amazon, Microsoft, and Apple stock. The document details payment at maturity, contingent coupon conditions, early redemption options, and significant risk considerations for investors, including the creditworthiness of Barclays and the potential impact of U.K. Bail-in Power. It also lists purchase considerations and tax implications for potential investors.

title: Alphabet Drops 7% Post Q4 Earnings: Buy, Sell or Hold the Stock?
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) shares dropped 7% after its Q4 2025 earnings report, primarily due to investor concerns over the high capital expenditure guidance for 2026, aimed at building AI and cloud infrastructure. Despite strong cash flow and continued dominance in search and cloud with significant AI integration, the stock is considered overvalued with a "Hold" rating from Zacks. The company's AI advancements are boosting user engagement and enterprise client adoption, but increased spending, capacity constraints, and valuation concerns temper short-term enthusiasm.

title: Health Catalyst and F5 Stocks Trade Down, What You Need To Know
summary: Health Catalyst (HCAT) and F5 (FFIV) stocks fell significantly, 6.8% and 6.7% respectively, during an afternoon session as investors grew more selective in the AI boom and reevaluated interest rate cut expectations. A stronger-than-expected U.S. jobs report pushed back anticipated Federal Reserve rate cuts to July, creating headwinds for growth-oriented sectors like software. Health Catalyst shares have been highly volatile, experiencing a significant decline since the start of the year and trading well below its 52-week high.

title: Here’s why Apple stock is plunging on Thursday
summary: Apple (AAPL) stock fell nearly 4% on Thursday as investors shifted away from large technology companies. This rotation is part of a broader market trend where funds are moving towards more diverse sectors like industrials and energy, rather than indicating specific negative news for Apple. Analysts suggest the "easy part" of the tech rally might be over, prompting a reassessment of tech valuations and a move towards "AI enablers" rather than just "AI beneficiaries."

title: Marcus & Millichap stock hits 52-week low at $24.93
summary: Marcus & Millichap's (MMI) stock recently hit a 52-week low of $24.93, marking a 32.65% decline over the past year due to challenging market conditions. Despite not being profitable in the last twelve months, the company maintains financial stability with an Altman Z-Score of 4.85. Investors are awaiting upcoming earnings on February 13, and the company's IPA Capital Markets division recently arranged a significant refinancing deal for a luxury multifamily property.

title: Can Jabil's Consumer Electronics Expertise Boost Future Profits?
summary: Jabil Inc. is focusing on strengthening its position in the consumer electronics market by enhancing its manufacturing capabilities and partnerships with leading technology brands like Apple and Amazon, offering end-to-end solutions for various connected devices. The company faces competition from Benchmark Electronics and Flex Ltd., both of whom also provide extensive design and manufacturing services in the consumer electronics sector. Despite having gained less than the industry average in the past year, Jabil's stock has a favorable price/earnings ratio and its earnings estimates for 2026 and 2027 have been revised upwards, earning it a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).

title: Alphabet Drops 7% Post Q4 Earnings: Buy, Sell or Hold the Stock?
summary: Alphabet's shares dropped 7% after its Q4 2025 earnings report due to investor concerns over the high capital expenditure guidance for AI and cloud infrastructure, which will squeeze free cash flow despite strong cash generation. While the company's AI push is boosting its Search and Cloud businesses and 2026 earnings estimates are positive, its shares are considered overvalued. Given the overvaluation, high capital expenses, and expected pressure on profitability, Zacks has a "Hold" rating for GOOGL stock.

title: Big-Name Hedges Fund Bought This ETF Last Quarter. It’s Crushing the SPY in 2026
summary: Davis Advisors, a hedge fund managing over $22 billion, acquired shares of the iShares S&P 500 Value ETF (IVE) in Q4 2025. This value-focused ETF has returned almost 5% year-to-date in 2026, significantly outperforming the S&P 500's 1% gain. The article suggests that investing in IVE could be a wise move for investors looking to counter a potentially overvalued broader market and benefit from its exposure to value stocks and specific tech giants like Apple and Amazon.

title: LSV Asset Management Buys 233,066 Shares of Skyworks Solutions, Inc. $SWKS
summary: LSV Asset Management increased its stake in Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS) by 13.9%, purchasing 233,066 additional shares to own a total of 1,909,536 shares valued at approximately $147 million. The semiconductor manufacturer recently reported strong quarterly earnings, beating EPS expectations with $1.54 vs. $1.40, and announced a $0.71 quarterly dividend, despite a high payout ratio. Analysts currently rate the stock as a "Hold" with a consensus target price of $70.50.

title: GLOBALFOUNDRIES Inc. (NASDAQ:GFS) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: GLOBALFOUNDRIES Inc. (NASDAQ:GFS) reported strong Q4 and full-year 2025 results, with Q4 revenue up 8% sequentially and EPS of $0.55, beating expectations. The company highlighted significant progress in strategic objectives, including technology differentiation through acquisitions in silicon photonics and physical AI, deepened customer partnerships, and leveraging its diversified global manufacturing footprint. GFS provided optimistic guidance for Q1 2026, expecting continued revenue and gross margin expansion, and announced a $500 million share repurchase authorization.

title: Apple iPhone stands out: only smartphone to grow in China sales this January- Counterpoint
summary: Apple's iPhone was the only smartphone brand to achieve sales growth in China during January, according to Counterpoint Research. This growth occurred while major Chinese mobile manufacturers like Huawei and Xiaomi experienced significant declines in the market. The article highlights Apple's unique performance in a challenging Chinese smartphone market.

title: Coherent Faces Ownership Shift As Texas Grant Supports Growth Plans
summary: Bain Capital plans to sell a significant stake in Coherent (NYSE:COHR), coinciding with a $14.1 million grant from Texas to expand the company's indium phosphide wafer manufacturing for data center and communications applications. This ownership shift occurs after strong stock performance for Coherent, and investors are advised to monitor how the market absorbs the block sale and updates on the Sherman, Texas facility's progress. The grant supports Coherent's expansion into AI and cloud markets, but analysts flag risks including insider selling and competition.

title: Coherent Faces Ownership Shift As Texas Grant Supports Growth Plans
summary: Bain Capital plans to sell a significant portion of its stake in Coherent (NYSE:COHR), coinciding with the company receiving a $14.1 million Texas grant to expand indium phosphide wafer manufacturing for datacenter and communications applications. This ownership shift, coupled with supported expansion, provides a new angle for investors to consider Coherent's capital allocation and manufacturing execution. The company has shown strong share price growth and operating performance, but investors should also consider risks like insider selling and competition.

title: Short Interest in GraniteShares 2x Long AAPL Daily ETF (NASDAQ:AAPB) Decreases By 58.7%
summary: Short interest in GraniteShares 2x Long AAPL Daily ETF (NASDAQ:AAPB) saw a significant drop of 58.7% in January, totaling 52,885 shares by January 30th. Institutional investors like Simplex Trading LLC, Woodward Diversified Capital LLC, and Optiver Holding B.V. have recently adjusted their positions in the ETF. The firm also announced a monthly dividend of $1.4092 per share, paid on December 31st.

title: FMR LLC Reduces Stake in Amdocs Ltd: A Strategic Portfolio Adjus
summary: FMR LLC significantly reduced its stake in Amdocs Ltd by decreasing its position by over 3.8 million shares, representing a 23.94% reduction. This strategic adjustment, occurring on December 31, 2025, now leaves Amdocs Ltd as a smaller portion of FMR LLC's diversified portfolio, which includes major tech companies like Apple and Amazon. Despite the reduction, Amdocs Ltd, a leader in digital transformation solutions, maintains strong financial metrics with a market capitalization of $7.56 billion and an undervalued stock price relative to its GF Value.

title: Apple’s Siri Upgrade Potentially Delayed After Testing Issues: Report
summary: Apple's planned upgrades for its virtual assistant Siri are reportedly facing delays due to testing issues, where Siri struggled with processing queries correctly or took too long to respond. Initially set for a March rollout with the iOS 26.4 beta, the functional changes may now be deferred to future updates, possibly in May or September with iOS 27. Despite the potential delay, analysts believe Apple's long-term AI strategy, including a rumored AI chatbot for Siri, still holds significant value for investors, especially as the company reported a strong Q1 2026 driven by iPhone sales.

title: Citi Remains Bullish on Seagate Technology Holdings (STX) Amid Stable Demand
summary: Citi has reaffirmed its 'Buy' rating on Seagate Technology Holdings (STX) and increased its price target from $460 to $480, citing stable demand from enterprise customers increasing data center capacity for AI workloads. Seagate's recent earnings report projected higher-than-consensus third-quarter revenue and reported strong second-quarter results, driven by the growing need for high-capacity storage fueled by AI-driven data creation. The company specializes in data storage solutions, including hard disk drives, catering to enterprise, cloud, and consumer markets.

title: These 3 Companies Shattered Quarterly Records
summary: Apple, Eaton, and SoFi Technologies recently announced record-breaking quarterly results for Q4 2025. Apple reported new highs in revenue, EPS, iPhone sales, and Services revenue. Eaton achieved record adjusted EPS and quarterly sales, driven by accelerating orders and backlog growth, while SoFi recorded all-time highs in new member additions, fee-based revenue, and loan originations.

title: With Apple Allure Intact, Consider Trading This ETF
summary: Shares of Apple (AAPL) have risen 6% in the last month due to a strong fourth-quarter earnings report, driven by better-than-expected iPhone sales and investor confidence in its AI plans. This rally presents a potential opportunity for traders with the Direxion Daily AAPL Bull 2X Shares (AAPU), a leveraged ETF designed for short-term tactical trading. Future catalysts for AAPU could include continued iPhone sales growth, improved gross margins, and further clarity on Apple's AI strategy, such as its partnership with Google's Gemini.

title: Analyzing Apple In Comparison To Competitors In Technology Hardware, Storage & Peripherals Industry
summary: This article analyzes Apple's financial performance and market position within the Technology Hardware, Storage & Peripherals industry by comparing it to its peers. It examines Apple's debt-to-equity ratio, valuation metrics (P/E, P/B, P/S), profitability (ROE, EBITDA, Gross Profit), and revenue growth. The analysis suggests that while Apple demonstrates strong profitability and efficient resource utilization, its revenue growth is lagging behind the industry average.

title: PayPal Issues Disappointing 2026 Outlook, Citing Competitive Pressures and Macro Headwinds; Investigation Probes Timing of Risk Disclosures
summary: Levi & Korsinsky, LLP is investigating PayPal Holdings, Inc. following its weaker-than-expected 2026 financial outlook, which projects a decline in transaction margin dollars and significantly decelerated revenue growth. The firm is examining whether PayPal's management timely disclosed material information regarding competitive pressures and macro headwinds, given the substantial drop in share price after the guidance was released. Shareholders who suffered losses are encouraged to contact the firm for a case evaluation.

title: Kuzu database company joins Apple’s list of recent acquisitions
summary: Apple recently acquired Kuzu, a database company, adding it to a list of acquisitions that includes the AI startup Q.ai and several others reported to the European Union under the Digital Markets Act. Kuzu's LinkedIn describes it as an "embedded graph database," and its acquisition, likely a relatively small deal, occurred in October. The article also provides a rundown of other acquisitions Apple made in 2025, as reported by the EU.

title: VV Handidly Beat the S&P 500, And Only Charges 0.04%
summary: The Vanguard Large-Cap ETF (VV) has outperformed the S&P 500 over five years, boasting an 86.22% return compared to the S&P 500's 78.13%. With an ultra-low expense ratio of 0.04% and a portfolio heavily weighted in mega-cap tech stocks like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft, VV offers broad U.S. large-cap exposure. While it provides strong long-term growth and a steady dividend, investors should be aware of its concentration and sector risks, particularly its heavy exposure to the technology sector.

title: Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE:SPOT) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE:SPOT) reported strong Q4 2025 earnings, beating expectations with a reported EPS of $5.2 against an expected $3.21. The earnings call highlighted robust MAU growth, record Wrapped engagement, and substantial payouts to music rights holders, totaling nearly $70 billion since the company's founding. Discussions heavily featured Spotify's strategic embrace of AI to enhance personalization, drive user engagement, and transform internal processes, positioning the company as a leading intelligent media platform.

title: The most unexpected winner of the AI boom? Caterpillar
summary: Caterpillar, traditionally known for construction vehicles, has emerged as a surprising beneficiary of the AI boom, with its stock doubling in the past year to an all-time high. The company's growing exposure to data centers, energy infrastructure, and AI-related demand, supplying critical equipment rather than developing AI itself, has driven its market capitalization to $347 billion. Its record full-year sales of $67.6 billion and a $51 billion order backlog underscore strong demand and a shift towards energy and power solutions, outperforming tech giants like Apple and Microsoft in stock growth.

title: PPG Industries stock hits 52-week high at 129.19 USD By Investing.com
summary: PPG Industries stock reached a new 52-week high of $129.19, reflecting robust performance with a 14.76% price return over the past year and a 24.53% year-to-date gain. The company's financial health is rated "GOOD" by InvestingPro, despite a recent earnings per share miss, with continued interest from financial experts due to its strategic initiatives and market position. PPG maintains a dividend yield of 2.23% and has paid dividends for 56 consecutive years.

title: Google and Apple agree to app store changes after British regulators ‘duopoly’ claim
summary: Google and Apple have agreed to implement changes in their app stores following an intervention by the U.K.'s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). The CMA previously accused the tech giants of maintaining an "effective duopoly," giving them unfair advantages. Both companies have committed to not discriminating against other developers' apps, ranking applications transparently, and providing developers with greater access to iOS features to foster competition within the U.K.'s app economy.

title: Hercules Capital (HTGC) To Report Earnings Tomorrow: Here Is What To Expect
summary: Hercules Capital (HTGC) is scheduled to report earnings tomorrow after market close. Analysts anticipate a 16.2% year-on-year revenue growth to $141.5 million and adjusted earnings of $0.49 per share. The company has a history of missing Wall Street's revenue estimates and its stock has underperformed, down 8.9% over the last month.

title: Fiserv's (NASDAQ:FISV) Q4 CY2025: Beats On Revenue
summary: Fiserv (NASDAQ:FISV) announced strong Q4 CY2025 results, surpassing Wall Street's revenue expectations with a 7.8% year-on-year increase to $5.28 billion, and a non-GAAP profit of $1.99 per share that beat consensus estimates. Despite positive earnings, the company's adjusted EPS guidance for the upcoming financial year 2026 slightly missed analyst estimates, leading to a minor dip in stock performance immediately after the announcement. The company's CEO, Mike Lyons, highlighted significant milestones and client wins during this period, attributing success to the "One Fiserv plan."

title: JPMorgan Wins Apple Card Role And Expands Undervalued Consumer Payments Reach
summary: JPMorgan Chase has taken over as the issuer for the Apple Card, replacing Goldman Sachs, integrating it deeper into consumer payments and everyday spending. This move places JPMorgan at the core of Apple's consumer credit offerings, potentially expanding its banking and card services to Apple Card users. Despite recent soft momentum in its share price, Simply Wall St estimates NYSE:JPM is trading approximately 22.3% below its fair value.

title: 5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Buy as Dow Hits a New Milestone
summary: The Dow Index recently crossed the 50,000 mark for the first time, signaling a shift in market participant interest from technology to cyclical stocks. This article recommends five blue-chip stocks with a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) that are poised for continued growth. These include Apple Inc., NVIDIA Corp., The Goldman Sachs Group Inc., Salesforce Inc., and Walmart Inc., each highlighted for their strong performance, strategic initiatives, and favorable growth prospects.

title: The Glass Architecture of AI: A Comprehensive Research Feature on Corning Inc. (GLW)
summary: Corning Inc. (GLW) has transformed from a traditional glass and ceramics manufacturer into a critical enabler of the generative AI revolution, leveraging its fiber-optic solutions and glass substrates for next-generation semiconductors. The company's strategic "Springboard" growth plan, coupled with significant partnerships with tech giants like Meta and Apple, has led to substantial financial growth and a re-rating by the market. Despite risks such as valuation and geopolitical exposure, Corning is well-positioned to benefit from the increasing demand for high-bandwidth connectivity and advanced chip packaging, supported by U.S. industrial policy.

title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Bernstein Raises Valuation Forecast
summary: Bernstein analyst Toni Sacconaghi has increased the 12-month price target for Apple Inc. (AAPL) to $340.00 from $325.00, maintaining an "Outperform" rating. This upward revision is due to improved visibility into Apple's high-margin and consistent services growth, along with its strong capital return strategy. Despite potential near-term share price volatility and mixed hardware demand, Bernstein believes Apple's ecosystem strength, services mix, and disciplined capital allocation position it for market outperformance.

title: NLPC Urges Apple Investors to Vote for Accountability Regarding China Risk
summary: The National Legal and Policy Center (NLPC) is advocating for Apple investors to support Proposal No. 5, which calls for a "China Entanglement Audit" from Apple's board of directors. Despite withdrawing its own climate-related shareholder proposal, NLPC emphasizes the need for transparency regarding the risks associated with Apple's significant manufacturing presence in China ahead of the annual meeting on February 24. They argue that shareholders need this report to accurately assess investment risks, given Apple's deep ties to the Chinese Communist Party's political and economic decisions.

title: Qualcomm (QCOM) Beats Estimates as Piper Sandler Reiterates Overweight Rating
summary: Qualcomm (QCOM) reported stronger-than-expected earnings and revenue for Q1 fiscal 2026, with EPS of $3.50 and revenue of $12.25 billion, beating analyst forecasts. Despite the beat, Piper Sandler reiterated an Overweight rating with a $200 price target, noting tempered March guidance due to memory constraints at OEMs, particularly in China, which will impact the handset business, though Automotive and IoT segments show strong growth. The firm anticipates a longer-term impact from memory conditions and the Apple agreement, with potential boosts from clarity on Qualcomm's data center strategy.

title: Ragnarok: Twilight Official Launching in Vietnam on February 10, 2026
summary: GRAVITY Co., Ltd. has officially launched its MMORPG mobile game, Ragnarok: Twilight, in Vietnam on February 10, 2026. This launch follows successful performances in other regions, including China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macau, and various Southeast Asian countries where the game achieved high rankings in downloads and grossing charts. Gravity aims to continue its good service in Vietnam and encourages users to enjoy the game's features and celebratory events.

title: Gravity Co., Ltd. Launches Ragnarok: Twilight MMORPG Mobile Game in Vietnam
summary: GRAVITY Co., Ltd. has launched its mobile MMORPG, Ragnarok: Twilight, in Vietnam on February 10, 2026. This game, based on the popular Ragnarok IP, has achieved significant success in other regions and offers features like fast-paced growth, a hero transformation system, and a 100% drop rate for rare items from MVP bosses. Gravity aims to replicate this success in Vietnam and encourages player participation in launch events.

title: Bull of the Day: Broadcom (AVGO)
summary: Broadcom (AVGO) is highlighted as a "Strong Buy" due to its dominant positions in the semiconductor and software industries, particularly benefiting from the AI data center buildout. The company offers an alternative to Nvidia with its custom AI accelerators and has high-margin recurring revenue from its software segment, including VMware. Broadcom boasts a robust growth outlook, consistently beating earnings estimates, and strong technical performance.

title: The Glass Architecture of AI: A Comprehensive Research Feature on Corning Inc. (GLW)
summary: Corning Inc. (GLW) has transformed its image from a traditional glass manufacturer into a pivotal "picks and shovels" player in the generative AI revolution, leveraging its high-density fiber-optic solutions and glass substrates for next-generation semiconductors. The company's "Springboard" growth plan has driven significant stock performance and financial results, with record core sales and EPS in 2025. Corning's strategic shift, partnerships with tech giants like Meta and Apple, and leadership in key AI and optical communication technologies position it as a major beneficiary of current industry trends despite facing valuation and geopolitical risks.

title: Stifel initiates coverage on CEVA stock with Buy rating, $30 target By Investing.com
summary: Stifel has initiated coverage on CEVA Inc. (NASDAQ:CEVA) with a Buy rating and a $30 price target, citing the company's strong position in wireless connectivity IP for power-efficient on-device sensing and inference applications. The firm believes CEVA's low power NPU and DSP IP portfolios are well-placed to benefit from AI infrastructure growth towards the network edge, despite recognizing near-term challenges such as mobile handset demand and uncertainty regarding Apple's modem efforts. CEVA's high gross profit margins (87.17%) and recent strategic partnerships, including a NPU deal with Microchip Technology, validate its long-term strategy in the edge-AI market.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Holdings Decreased by TLW Wealth Management LLC
summary: TLW Wealth Management LLC reduced its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 6.5% during the third quarter, reducing its holdings to 50,473 shares valued at $12.85 million. Despite this, Apple remains the firm's sixth-largest holding. Meanwhile, other institutional investors like Vanguard Group Inc., State Street Corp, Geode Capital Management LLC, Norges Bank, and Northern Trust Corp significantly increased their positions in Apple.

title: Keysight Technologies stock hits all-time high at 233.16 USD By Investing.com
summary: Keysight Technologies (KEYS) stock reached an all-time high of $233.16 USD, reflecting strong investor confidence and market performance with a 32.49% increase over the past year. The company maintains a robust financial position and has recently unveiled new electric vehicle charging test solutions and partnerships, including collaborations with Point2 Technology for AI data centers and Airbus UpNext for 5G non-terrestrial networks. These advancements highlight Keysight's strategic initiatives and operational excellence across various technological sectors.

title: Apple stock slips in year-end trading as tech drags; what investors watch next
summary: Apple shares eased slightly in late-morning trading on the final day of 2025, reflecting broader tech sector movements and thin holiday liquidity. The stock's performance is often a bellwether for market sentiment, with investors now calibrating positions for 2026 amidst Federal Reserve interest rate discussions. Upcoming earnings reports in late January will be a key focus for Apple investors, particularly regarding iPhone demand and services revenue.

title: Apple stock slips after hours to close out 2025; what AAPL traders are watching next
summary: Apple shares experienced a slight dip of about 0.4% in after-hours trading, closing out 2025 with muted activity due to year-end profit-taking and thin holiday liquidity. The focus for traders now shifts to early-January trading conditions, the late-January Federal Reserve meeting, and Apple's upcoming earnings report expected around January 29th. The stock's current price-to-earnings ratio of 30 makes it sensitive to changes in interest rate expectations.

title: Alphabet (GOOG) slips after hours even as Citizens lifts target to $385 — what’s next for Google stock
summary: Alphabet's Class C shares experienced a slight dip in after-hours trading despite Citizens raising its price target to $385, driven by anticipated AI-driven gains in Google Search. Investors are focused on whether Google's AI innovations will translate into sustained query growth and advertising demand in 2026, especially after a year of significant AI investment. The stock's performance in early January, alongside upcoming earnings and increasing competition in AI-powered search, will be crucial valuation factors.

title: Apple’s Global AI Conquest: The Great Wall of Intelligence and the Alibaba Pivot
summary: Apple has transitioned to a dominant "AI Orchestrator" with the global rollout of Apple Intelligence, including a key partnership with Alibaba for the Chinese market. This strategy includes a "Privacy-First" hybrid model using Private Cloud Compute and a localized AI approach in China through Alibaba's Tongyi Qianwen models. The move has re-established Apple's market position, especially in China, and altered the competitive landscape by commoditizing LLMs and emphasizing privacy-by-design.

title: Warren Buffett Added a Big Chunk of This Tech Stock. Should You Add It Too?
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway recently increased its position in Alphabet (GOOGL), acquiring 17.85 million Class A shares valued at around $4 billion in Q3 2025. This move is significant given Buffett's general avoidance of mega-cap tech stocks, and follows past regrets from Munger and Buffett about not investing in Google sooner. The article highlights Alphabet's strong Q3 2025 performance with advertising revenue growing to $74.182 billion and total revenue increasing by 16%, making GOOGL a worthy investment regardless of Buffett's involvement.

title: Investing Legend Warren Buffett Bids Adieu to Wall Street, While His Trillion-Dollar Company, Berkshire Hathaway, Enters a New Era
summary: Warren Buffett is stepping down as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway on December 31, 2025, marking the end of an illustrious investing career. Greg Abel will take over as CEO, overseeing a transition that is expected to be seamless in some respects due to shared investment philosophies, but also bring changes, particularly in portfolio management and sector focus. While Buffett's long-term value investing approach built the company, Abel is expected to actively manage smaller holdings and potentially introduce more technology and healthcare stocks into Berkshire's core investments.

title: Nvidia, TSMC rise as the world’s most valuable company reportedly asks for more chips to meet Chinese demand
summary: Nvidia and TSMC are experiencing a premarket surge following reports that Nvidia requested TSMC to increase production of its H200 AI chips to meet significant Chinese demand. This comes after news that Nvidia will ship its top-performing Hopper generation processors to China, with Chinese companies reportedly placing orders for over 2 million chips for 2026. The ability to fulfill this demand, which could provide a $54 billion revenue boost for Nvidia, is contingent on Chinese regulatory approval.

title: B. Riley Financial | Diversified Financial Services Platform
summary: As 2026 begins, financial markets are scrutinizing whether "AI Premium" tech valuations are justified, demanding profitability proof instead of just promises. The article highlights a widening "ROI Gap," where hardware providers like Nvidia have thrived, but software monetizers face skepticism due to high capital expenditures and stretched P/E ratios. It predicts a "Great Rotation" as capital shifts away from overextended mega-caps, favoring companies like Alphabet and Meta, while Amazon and Nvidia face "digestion periods" and a new focus on sustainable, high-quality earnings under increased regulatory pressure.

title: Meritas Wealth Management LLC Cuts Stock Position in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Meritas Wealth Management LLC reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 9.8% in Q3 2025, selling 4,415 shares and ending the period with 40,611 shares valued at $10.34 million. Despite this trimming, Apple remains the firm's seventh-largest position, representing 5.1% of its portfolio. While insiders have been net sellers, institutional ownership remains high, and Apple reported strong earnings and pays a quarterly dividend.

title: YieldMax AAPL Option Income Strategy ETF (NYSEARCA:APLY) Shares Down 0.1% – Here’s What Happened
summary: YieldMax AAPL Option Income Strategy ETF (APLY) shares experienced a 0.1% decline on Tuesday, with 62,738 shares traded, a 53% decrease from the average session volume. The ETF recently declared a $0.176 dividend, paying out on December 29th to shareholders of record on December 26th, representing a dividend yield of 2,022.0%. APLY, launched on April 18, 2023, is an actively managed exchange-traded fund focused on information technology, utilizing a synthetic covered call strategy on Apple stock (AAPL) to generate income and capped gains.

title: Barclays Capital Maintains “Sell” Rating on Apple Inc. (AAPL)
summary: Barclays Capital has reiterated its "Sell" rating for Apple Inc. (AAPL) with a 12-month price target of $230, citing concerns over slowing growth in key product categories and intense competition. title: TSMC Ex-VP's Home Raided As Chip Giant Alleges Intel Recruit Leaked Trade Secrets

title: Apple contests India’s antitrust penalty law with risk of $38 billion fine, filing shows
summary: Apple is challenging India's new antitrust penalty law that could lead to a fine of up to $38 billion based on its global turnover. The company argues that penalties should only be based on Indian revenue of the specific unit violating antitrust law, deeming the current law "manifestly arbitrary, unconstitutional, grossly disproportionate, unjust." Apple's challenge comes as the CCI investigates alleged "abusive conduct" related to its iOS app market.

title: Cayman Islands - Appleby Advises Blue Acquisition Corp. In Its Definitive Business Combination Agreement With Blockfusion USA, Inc. With A Transaction Value Of USD450M
summary: Appleby served as Cayman Islands legal counsel to Blue Acquisition Corp. in its definitive business combination agreement with Blockfusion USA, Inc., a transaction valued at USD450 million. Upon closing, the combined entity will be named Blockfusion Data Centers, Inc., and its securities are anticipated to be listed on The Nasdaq Stock Market LLC. This transaction further establishes Appleby's expertise in de-SPAC combinations and capital markets transactions.

title: Buffett's Big Bet Banks Billions: Here's How Much Berkshire Hathaway Is Up On Alphabet
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has seen a significant return on its investment in Alphabet stock, with gains exceeding $1.35 billion since the end of the second quarter. The investment in Alphabet, now Berkshire's 10th largest holding, marks a growing trend for the conglomerate to invest in technology stocks. While Berkshire Hathaway currently trails the S&P 500 year-to-date, its tech bets, including Alphabet and Apple, are closing the gap.

title: Google Stock Gains Momentum as Nvidia Faces Losses | NVDA
summary: Alphabet Inc. (Google) is experiencing significant stock momentum, nearing a $4 trillion market valuation and outperforming Microsoft, driven by strong Q3 results and AI advancements. Meanwhile, Nvidia's shares are under pressure due to concerns about its AI chip market dominance after Meta reportedly considered Google's AI chips, despite Nvidia's record Q3 earnings. Analysts view Alphabet as a more balanced investment due to its diverse business segments and growth prospects.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Position Trimmed by NORTHSTAR ASSET MANAGEMENT Co
summary: NORTHSTAR ASSET MANAGEMENT Co reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 10.1% in the second quarter, owning 164,037 shares valued at $33,655,000. Other institutional investors made minor adjustments to their holdings, and institutional investors collectively own 67.73% of Apple's stock. The article also provides details on Apple's stock performance, recent earnings, dividends, analyst ratings, and insider transactions.

title: Should State Street SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 ETF (SPYM) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The State Street SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 ETF (SPYM) is highlighted as a strong option for investors seeking broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market, especially given its low expense ratio of 0.02%. The article details its sector allocation, top holdings including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, and its performance, noting a 202.68% year-to-date return. It also compares SPYM to similar ETFs like IVV and VOO, emphasizing its "Buy" rank from Zacks ETF Rank.

title: Kayne Anderson BDC Appoints New President and VP
summary: Kayne Anderson BDC, Inc. (KBDC) has appointed Frank P. Karl as President and Andy Wedderburn-Maxwell as Senior Vice President. The company also declared a fourth-quarter 2025 dividend of $0.40 per share and reported strong financial results for Q3 2025 with $30 million in net investment income. Despite market volatility, KBDC maintains a defensively positioned, high-quality earnings mix, though an AI analysis suggests potential for a short-term pullback due to cash flow volatility and liquidity concerns.

title: T-Mobile Unwraps the Ultimate Apple Bundle — All on Us for Black Friday
summary: T-Mobile is launching a Black Friday Apple bundle offer, providing nearly $2000 in savings, including an iPhone 17 Pro, iPad (A16), and Apple Watch SE 3 "on Us." Additionally, new T-Mobile 5G Home Internet customers can get a month free and a $300 prepaid Mastercard, while also offering deals for families switching to T-Mobile. The company is also enhancing customer perks through its T-Life app and Magenta Status benefits, such as a free year of DashPass by DoorDash for a limited time.

title: Analysts Are Bullish on Top Technology Stocks: Block (XYZ), Apple (AAPL)
summary: Two prominent technology companies, Block (XYZ) and Apple (AAPL), have received bullish sentiments from analysts according to recent reports. David Koning of Robert W. Baird reiterated a Buy rating on Block with a $90.00 price target, while Samik Chatterjee from J.P. Morgan maintained a Buy rating on Apple with a $305.00 price target. Both companies are seen as having strong growth potential within the Technology sector.

title: T-Mobile Unwraps the Ultimate Apple Bundle — All on Us for Black Friday
summary: T-Mobile is offering significant Black Friday savings, including an "All on Us" Apple bundle featuring the new iPhone 17 Pro, iPad (A16), and Apple Watch SE 3. The deals, starting November 26, extend to both new and existing customers, with additional incentives for new 5G Home Internet customers and exclusive perks through the T-Life app.

title: AlTi Global Inc. Has $60.97 Million Holdings in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: AlTi Global Inc. significantly increased its stake in Apple Inc. during the second quarter, now holding 292,230 shares valued at $60.97 million, making Apple its 13th largest position. Despite company insiders being net sellers of Apple stock, the iPhone maker exceeded quarterly earnings and revenue estimates. Apple maintains a "Moderate Buy" analyst consensus with an average target price of $278.22 and pays a quarterly dividend of $0.26.

title: Apple cuts dozens of sales roles in major restructuring
summary: Apple Inc. has cut dozens of jobs within its global sales division to streamline operations serving businesses, educational institutions, and government agencies. This rare move, affecting account managers and briefing center staff, aims to remove overlapping responsibilities and reduce internal costs despite strong revenue growth and comes as Apple aligns with a broader tech sector trend of cost restructuring. Affected employees have until January 20 to find another internal position or will receive severance.

title: Why Nvidia Stock Could Reach a $20 Trillion Market Cap by 2030
summary: This article argues that Nvidia (NVDA) could realistically achieve a $20 trillion market capitalization by 2030, driven by its aggressive product roadmap, impenetrable CUDA software ecosystem, and dominance in AI systems. The author highlights Nvidia's data center segment needing to grow at a 36% CAGR and discusses the company's significant revenue visibility from its Blackwell and Rubin GPUs, along with accelerating Big Tech capex in AI infrastructure. The analysis is supported by historical forecasts from the author regarding Nvidia's growth and market position.

title: Best Buy (BBY) Stock Today, Nov. 25, 2025: Price, 5% Yield and What to Watch Before Earnings
summary: Best Buy (BBY) stock declined 1.1% on November 25, 2025, ahead of its critical Q3 FY26 earnings report, despite a strong broader market. Investors are keenly watching the earnings to assess the impact of tariffs and holiday demand, given BBY's 5% dividend yield and current valuation. Key themes for the earnings include comparable sales, margin trends due to product mix and tariffs, and the potential impact of its retail media business.

title: Apple cuts jobs in latest round of tech layoffs
summary: Apple announced a new round of job cuts across its sales teams, specifically targeting account managers for businesses, schools, and government agencies, as well as staff operating briefing centers. The company stated that these layoffs affect a small number of roles and are designed to strengthen customer engagement, with affected employees eligible to apply for new positions. These layoffs come amidst a trend of other major tech companies like Verizon, Synopsys, and IBM also announcing job reductions.

title: iPhone 17 Boosts Apple's China Sales: What's Ahead for the Stock?
summary: Apple's latest iPhone 17 series has significantly boosted its sales in China, with October sales jumping 37% year over year, despite facing strong competition and other headwinds. The company expects double-digit growth in iPhone sales for the December quarter in Greater China, driven by the new iPhone portfolio and Apple Intelligence features. However, Apple faces tough competition in the AI space from companies like Alphabet and Microsoft, and its stock is currently trading at a premium with a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold).

title: Alphabet (GOOG) Stock Soars Above $315 as AI Wave Pushes Valuation Toward $4 Trillion – 24 November 2025
summary: Alphabet's Class C shares (GOOG) surged above $315, pushing its market valuation towards $4 trillion, driven by strong Q3 2025 earnings, renewed confidence in its AI leadership with Gemini 3, and significant growth in Google Cloud. The stock's rally of 70-75% over the past year reflects growing investor enthusiasm, although analysts note rich valuations and ongoing antitrust risks. The company's vertically integrated AI strategy, including custom chips and a new NATO cloud deal, further bolsters its position.

title: Apple shares hit new all-time closing high
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) shares reached a new all-time closing high of $276.15 on November 24, 2025, rising 1.63%. The company's market value stands at $4.095 trillion, making it the world's second-most valuable company. The article also lists the market values of other top U.S. publicly traded companies.

title: Vanguard Group Inc. Sells 983,520 Shares of Skyworks Solutions, Inc. $SWKS
summary: Vanguard Group Inc. reduced its stake in Skyworks Solutions, Inc. by selling 983,520 shares, though it still holds 13.31% of the company valued at $1.47 billion. Skyworks Solutions recently announced a quarterly dividend of $0.71, and its Q3 2025 earnings beat analyst estimates. The article also details insider stock sales and provides an overview of Skyworks' stock performance and analyst ratings.

title: Apple’s Services Business Hits a Record–Big Growth in Q4 2025
summary: Apple announced record-high Services revenue in Q4 2025, reaching over $28.8 billion, demonstrating a successful shift in strategy from hardware to a digital ecosystem. This growth, driven by subscriptions, digital purchases, and Apple Pay, provides financial stability and resources for further product improvement. Despite challenges like competition and regulation, Apple plans to continue investing in its Services, indicating a future where digital experiences and hardware are deeply integrated.

title: FXAIX vs VOO: Is Fidelity or Vanguard Better for S&P 500 Exposure?
summary: This article compares Fidelity's FXAIX and Vanguard's VOO, both S&P 500 index funds, to help investors decide which is better for their needs. It analyzes their fees, structure (mutual fund vs. ETF), tax efficiency, performance, and suitability for different account types and trading styles. While FXAIX has a slightly lower expense ratio, VOO generally offers better tax efficiency and intraday tradability.

title: Aris Mining Corp stock hits 52-week high at 12.1 USD
summary: Aris Mining Corp (ARMN) has achieved a new 52-week high of $12.10, showcasing a 183.45% appreciation over the last year and a 90.95% return in the past six months. With a market capitalization of $2.44 billion and a "GREAT" financial health rating, the company's strong performance reflects significant investor confidence. Despite a high P/E ratio of 45.57, analysts anticipate continued net income growth, suggesting potential for future gains.

title: QQQI ETF Soars With $297.7M Inflows, 14.09% Yield, and $53.93 Price — Nasdaq Income Giant Strengthens
summary: The NEOS NASDAQ-100 High Income ETF (NYSEARCA:QQQI) has reinforced its leadership among high-yield income ETFs, attracting $297.7 million in new capital over the last week of November. The fund, which trades near its 52-week high at $53.86 and boasts $6.27 billion in assets under management, offers a 14.09% annualized yield with monthly distributions. Its robust performance, tax efficiency, and downside protection make it a strong choice for income-focused investors.

title: NioCorp and FatPipe Interviews to Air on the RedChip Small Stocks, Big Money(TM) Show on Bloomberg TV
summary: RedChip Companies will feature interviews with NioCorp Developments Ltd. (Nasdaq: NB) and FatPipe, Inc. (Nasdaq: FATN) on its "RedChip Small Stocks, Big Money™" show. The program will air on Bloomberg TV, discussing NioCorp's critical mineral project and FatPipe's innovations in SD-WAN and cybersecurity. Both companies will highlight their market positions, strategic partnerships, and growth strategies.

title: Fold Launches Affiliate Program as Bitcoin Gift Card Gains Momentum on Holiday Gift Guides
summary: Fold Holdings, Inc. announced the launch of its new affiliate program, allowing content creators to earn commissions on sales of the Fold Bitcoin Gift Card. This initiative seeks to integrate bitcoin into everyday life by providing a unique gift option that can appreciate in value, unlike traditional gift cards. The company has partnered with Impact and plans to expand the program to include other financial products in 2026.

title: EZGO announces 1-for-25 reverse share split effective Nov 21
summary: EZGO Technologies Ltd. announced a 1-for-25 reverse share split, effective November 21, 2025, to increase its share price and maintain its Nasdaq listing. The split will reduce outstanding shares from over 21 million to approximately 868,029, with fractional shares rounded up. This move comes as the company's stock has faced significant declines, and they also recently enacted a warrant exchange agreement to manage their capital structure.
